question: What is the name of the online Linux command line introduction course?
answer: The course is named "Introduction à la ligne de commande Linux [en ligne, LNX101]".

question: When does the "Introduction à la ligne de commande Linux [en ligne, LNX101]" event start?
What is the end date and time for the "Introduction à la ligne de commande Linux [en ligne, LNX101]" event?
answer: The event ends on 2025-10-07 at 16:00:00 UTC.

question: Where can I register for the "Introduction à la ligne de commande Linux [en ligne, LNX101]" workshop?
What are the key topics covered in the "Introduction à la ligne de commande Linux" workshop?
answer: The workshop covers an introduction to the command line, file and directory trees, creation, deletion and management of files and directories, command combinations, redirections and filters, loops, Bash scripts, and search.

question: What is the main goal of the "Introduction à la ligne de commande Linux [en ligne, LNX101]" workshop?
answer: The workshop aims to teach participants to effectively use the command line, which is essential for advanced computing analyses like high-performance computing, managing files, and navigating folders.

question: What keyword is associated with the "Introduction à la ligne de commande Linux" event?
answer: The keyword associated with the event is "Shell".

question: What is the ID for the "Introduction à la ligne de commande Linux [en ligne, LNX101]" event?
What is the name of the event scheduled for October 7, 2025, from 4:00 PM to 5:30 PM UTC?
answer: The event is named "RAC Best Practices".

question: When is the "RAC Best Practices" session scheduled?
answer: It is scheduled for Tuesday, Oct 7, 2025, from 10am - 11:30am local time, corresponding to 2025-10-07 16:00:00 UTC to 2025-10-07 17:30:00 UTC.

question: Where can I find the registration form for the "RAC Best Practices" event?
answer: The registration form is available at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSena2LLtFFOtHzitlPxMePZX5MPV8JIV8Du-X_E87xGL8um2g/viewform.

question: What is the Resource Allocation Competition (RAC) according to the document?
answer: The Resource Allocation Competition (RAC) from the Digital Research Alliance of Canada is a way to access computing and storage resources beyond what is available by non-competitive means.

question: What types of resources can be obtained through the RAC?
answer: Resources can range from hundreds of cores or several GPUs and some extra terabytes of storage to thousands of cores and hundreds of terabytes of storage.

question: When are applications accepted for the annual Resource Allocation Competition?
answer: The annual competition is open for applications each October.

question: What topics will the "RAC Best Practices" session cover?
answer: The session will cover the most important things to consider when submitting an application to maximize success and will then open the floor to questions.

question: Where can I find other courses in the series related to "RAC Best Practices"?
answer: Other courses in this series can be found at https://www.ualberta.ca/en/information-services-and-technology/research-computing/bootcamps.html.

question: What is the ID for the "RAC Best Practices" event?
answer: The ID for the "RAC Best Practices" event is https://explora.alliancecan.ca/events/rac-best-practices-787ab970-7f9b-449e-832b-58ead44869de.

question: What is the duration of the "RAC Best Practices" session?
answer: The session is 1 hour and 30 minutes long.
